hero.title: [Rappler's Best] Marcos and the Arroyo ‘curse’
hero.description: 'As we do our audits, analyses, and Monday-morning quarterbacking on the biggest midterm upset in nearly two decades, it bears noting that na-Arroyo si Marcos'

primary.lead: Resignation Order to the President's Cabinet Secretaries
primary.title: Marcos orders courtesy resignation of all Cabinet secretaries
primary.description: Manila, Philippines — President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has called for the courtesy resignation of all Cabinet secretaries to recalibrate his administration following the results of the recent elections.

secondary.title: Marcos asks all Cabinet secretaries to resign
secondary.description: Following the unfavorable result of the recent midterm elections, President Marcos has called on all his Cabinet secretaries to hand in their resignations

secondary.title: Sharper, faster, cleaner: What Marcos is demanding from Cabinet after shakeup
secondary.description: Following a shock call for his secretaries to resign, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said he wants cabinet officials who act quickly and are free from corruption.

secondary.title: Marcos retains economic team in Cabinet revamp
secondary.description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is keeping his economic team following his call for all his Cabinet members to file their courtesy resignation in a bid to “realign government with the people’s expectations.”

carousel.title: Green card holder returning to U.S. held at Sea-Tac Airport for 4 days
carousel.description: Washington resident Maximo Londonio is being held in custody after a trip to the Philippines. He now expects to be transferred to a Tacoma detention center.

carousel.title: DepEd: 841 schools to join pilot run of revised SHS curriculum
carousel.description: Over 800 schools nationwide are set to participate in the pilot run of the revised Senior High School (SHS) curriculum of the basic education program this incoming School Year 2025-2026, the Department of Education (DepEd) said Monday.

carousel.title: The ‘obese’ dynasties of the Philippines are crowned again, but reform hopes rise for 2028 - PCIJ.org
carousel.description: Seventeen relatives of Luis “Chavit” Singson’s political clan ran’s political clan in local races in Ilocos Sur, a province in northern Luzon with a little more than 700,000 people. One lost her electoral bid. Singsons occupy the seats of governor, vice governor, provincial board members, district representatives, city and municipal officials.

carousel.title: Floods displace 192k people across Maguindanao del Sur
carousel.description: Flash floods submerged 98 villages across Maguindanao del Sur on Tuesday night, displacing 38,689 families or around 192,000 people, according to the region’s top official.
